definition[0]: material made from threads or wires that have been woven together like a net, or a piece of this material
example[0]: The windows were covered in wire mesh to keep out flies.
definition[1]: a complicated or difficult situation or system
example[2]: She had felt trapped by the old mesh of loyalty and shame.
definition[2]: if two ideas or things mesh, they fit together very well
example[3]: His own ideas did not mesh with the views of the party.
definition[3]: if two parts of an engine or machine mesh, they fit closely together and connect with each other
